Half Life 2, um dos melhores jogos de todos, Tem gráficos bonitos ( principalmente pra época, deixa muitos títulos no chinelo :/), Uma ótima história, ótimos personagens, ótimas armas, ótimos veiculos, ótimo desempenho em pc's fracos, MANO ESSE JOGO É ÓTIMO D+, vale cada centavo gasto (principalmente se for em uma promoção hehe) certamente você ira curtir esse jogo ao máximo e vai sentir aquela vontade de um HL3 na sua biblioteca... (que praticamente nunca vai acontecer né ;-;, vamos ter esperança sempre).
Realmente não tenho o que falar, 10/10, esse jogo foi o que revolucionou todo o modo de jogar FPS, sério...

Bem acho q é isso, Até a próxima ( ° .°)

Лучший FPS шутер для меня. Сюжет очень интересный (это то чего не хватает современным играм) а тут сюжет просто космос. Для игры такого года выпуска, она так долго держалась в топе FPS шутеров и получала сколько наград,что другим и не снилось в те года, вселенная такая огромная и запутанная и сколько еще секретов в ней есть и не раскрыто и не скоро раскроют, я могу сказать еще очень много хорошего в сторону любимой серии Half-Life, но скажу главное, если вы все ещё не играли в неё, вы обязаны это сделать это просто игра легенда. История, проникающая в вашу душу.Игра, которая показывает, что один человек может изменить мир, особенно хочется отметить, что атмосфера и звуковое сопровождение этого постапокалиптического мира, не должна оставить вас равнодушным, оно божественное! И вы так же с нетерпением будете ждать заветное продолжение этой культовой серии.
Half Life 3 - I believe, I'll wait.
UPD:конец 2018, я все ещё жду.
UPD2: конец 2019, ну новая часть для VR хоть что-то...
UPD3: 2020 мы получили ВРную Аликс, теперь осталось дождаться цифру 3.
UPD4: конец 2021, ждём.

Realmente excelente, evolução gráfica do primeiro e da jogabilidade. Mesmo sendo um jogo de quase 12 anos, tem gráficos agrádaveis. Caso venha o 3º, a certeza é de que será uma obra-prima gráficamente.
Топчик :D

The gameplay can be a bit dated, but honestly it's not bad at all. The strongest part of this game is it's presentation from the beginning of the game to the end, the story gets presented in a quick, yet interesting way. I was invested in scenes that were serious and the game actually got me scared at a certain segment. The puzzles are also entertaining to do, but not too hard to solve. In the end, I honestly wish Half Life 3 was confirmed because I would love to play another game like this.

Luego de terminar Half-Life 2,  sinceramente dare mi opinión.
Es un gran juego al que debes jugar (y más ahora que esta con descuento).
Nos cuenta la continuación de la historia de Gordon Freeman tras el incidente de Black Mesa, en donde los Combine dominan, deberas enfrentarte a nuevas amenazas y demás.

He visto criticas negativas diciendo que el juego es aburrido y demás, estoy casi seguro que en la mayoría de los casos no se terminaron el juego.

This game is intense. After completing Half-Life, i was determined to play all of the Half-Life games. When i got this game of course i was a little bit sceptical as Half-Life had been the best game i had played in a while. This game defied and exceeded my expectations. Challenging puzzles in a fps format with an amazing accompaning story. of course Half-Life will allway have a special place in my heart, this game is an outstanding sequel. I hope to see more half-life games in the forseeable future.

Das die Story und das Gameplay absolut Top sind ist klar, aber ich muss mal die Technische Seite loben. Grafisch immernoch sehr gut! Meiner Meinung nach Grafisch ansprechender als manche anderen (Heutigen) Spiele durch den Simplen Grafikstil und zudem Läuft es mit einer GTX 970 und einem AMD FX-6300 mit Hunderten von FPS. Performance Probleme sind hier ein Lächerlicher witz, da selbst ein 300€ Low End Laptop von 2011 (AMD A4-3300m) gut mit dem Spiel klar kommt.
I say stop using Steam untill they make Half-Life 3. They wont make it unless we hurt them where it counts.

se acostuma.

jogo.

Inovação: 11/10
Não tem o que dizer, esse jogo foi e ainda é uma inovação em tudo, na física, no desempenho, gráficos, TUDO! Te prende em todos os aspectos.

Média: 10/10 HYPER-RECOMENDO!

TL;DR at the bottom

First of all, no, I have not completed the game. I do plan to eventually take the time to finish the game, but currently my interest lies with good video games. There, I said it. In my personal opinion, Half-Life 2 is a hot mess of a video game that is extremely overrated and brings virtually nothing new to the table.

First of all, let's talk about what it does bring to the table: a semi-complex physics engine. While this sounds cool and revolutionary, all it really does is let you use a gun that shoots random objects in the world at people. Whoop dee frickin doo. Sure, the gun might be a cool gimmick, but the engine isn't really anything special, even for 2004 standards. And for some reason everyone praises the engine in HL2, when dare I say it that Windwaker, a console game (gasp), made better use of physics throughout its game with wind of all things, and like two years earlier.

Story. It's pretty meh. Now before I get criticized about criticizing the story even though I haven't finished it, take a minute to compare the opening of Half-Life 2 to the original Half-Life. The first game introduces you to people in the lab, not characters with names, but just people (this is important). It then introduces you to your equipment and tells you what the H.E.V. suit does. This is a good way of foreshadowing the player about what they will face in the game. It then has you do something that triggers all of the problems, and you're immediatly in the action and people are dying and you have to escape. On the other hand, in Half-Life 2 you have a similar opening, but this time you are introduced to the world, which is pretty cool. Going through, you have no real control about the events leading to your escape, and when you do, you are introduced to a character with a name (this is important). You go through the entire escape, and are out in the real game on a boat. Now that we've examined the way both games open, let's talk about why the opener in the first Half-Life is much better in relation to the entire game and story: the people. Characters are mostly nameless, and as a result everyone you come across is someone that you want to keep alive, and you feel guilty when you see people die. In Half-Life 2 on the other hand, you are introduced to named characters who are immediatly taken away from you. You are introduced to a story which is immediatly taken away from you. When you bump into regular people, if they die, they die. They weren't important to the story because they didn't have a name.

Gamepley. It's the same level as the original game, which is not a good thing. I would've expected some improvement, seeing as how it's 2004 and not 1998. I can forgive the first game, because it was the first true 3D shooter and they were still trying to figure out how to make a game like it work. For a second game released in 2004, however, I cannot forgive it. It feels like I'm skating around the place, which is really annoying because everyone else looks like they walk around pretty normally. Guns are pretty poorly designed, all feel like they have the same accuracy, just with different fire rates and ammo capacity. It also feels like there is less ammo lying around in this game, just so that they can force you to use the gimmicky gun more often to show off their semi-decent physics engine. To put it simply, all difficulty in this game comes from imprecise movement, poor accuracy on your guns, and a lack of ammo in the game.

TL;DR and conclusion: Half-Life 2 is an overrated game today, and was at release. It brings almost nothing new to the table with it's semi-decent physics engine for 2004. Gameplay is broken, and difficulty is dictated solely by poor gun and movement accuracy, along with a lack of supplies. The story I have experienced so far is mediocre at best, and the way the story and gameplay mix is really poor and completely takes you out of the immersion. If you want to experience a good shooter from Valve, play the first Half-Life and both expansions. If you want a good example of the Source engine, play the Portal games. If you want to see a game that shows what the Source engine with a Half-Life 2 twist really should be, get Garry's Mod. Because at the end of the day, broken gun and movement mechanics only work in a semi-party game where modders can fix all the problems that Valve was too snooty to fix. 

Stop praising this game, because the more you praise it and convince people to buy it, the less Valve will want to make Half-Life 3. It will never live up to your expectations the more you hype it up, and everytime you convince someone to buy a Half-Life game, Valve sees no financial benefit of creating a 3rd game. I am expecting a LOT of criticism from this review, and that's alright, as long as you are willing to take a step back and take a moment to think about my points of criticism. The only reason I would ever recommend this game to someone is if it's on sale, and they're interested in trying out different types of shooters. Otherwise, I would recommend this game to nobody and direct them towards the first game instead. And no, I do not have nostalgia goggles for the first game. I did not experience it until 2014. The only one's who have nostalgia goggles are a few of the Half-Life 2 elitists.

2.5/10

4) Marijuana is terrible for your physical health: How bad is marijuana for you? It's even more toxic than cigarette smoke. Regular users are hit with devastating lung problems as much as 20 years earlier than smokers. Even small amounts of marijuana can cause temporary sterility and it has a terrible impact on the babies of women who smoke including "birth defects, mental abnormalities and increased risk of leukemia in children." If your standard is, "Well, it's better for you than Meth or Crack," that's true, but you're deluding yourself if you think pot is anything other than absolutely horrible for your health.
